message: And, are there plans to have ep.io add redis settings to Django settings.py a la the postgres settings?
There seem to be a bunch of forks of django-redis-cache on github and around the web. Which are people using?
I'd like to use the redis service for my cache and session storage.
@pmclanahan I've been using https://github.com/sebleier/django-redis-cache, but the network graph does show a few possible alternatives. One of the minor issues with GH, really.
As for auto-appending settings, probably not - the cache settings vary based on how you do it, and the same with sessions (there's no real standard, unlike databases/celery).
If you're having issues, though, we can throw some more code examples up for configuring Django with it.
No problems. Just curious. It looks easy enough to use the dropped in config module. Thanks though.
Andrew - since I have no access to the redis config, what would be the best way to connect to the redis-cache
@liorsion The redis config is available via bundle_config - see the example in http://www.ep.io/docs/services/#redis-service
